info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 11 at 10:14PM PDT until October 12 at 1:15AM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave and southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM PDT /115 AM MST/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 PM PDT /1014 PM MST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Temple Bar Campground and Temple Bar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM PDT /115 AM MST/ SUNDAY
